climbs.name: Wish You Were Here
climbs.fa: bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle, Sept 2017

content.description:
P1: 5.8. Scramble up to the grassy ledge in the deep gully between Sea of Joy and Dark Side of the Moon formations. On the right side of the grassy ledge start climbing very featured limestone that is splattered with a generous amount of chert. Fun climbing on big holds leads to chain anchors in a small scoop.

P2: 5.10. Continue up on big holds and eventually the climbing gets steeper and the holds smaller. There is a steep white headwall guarding the chain anchors at the top of pitch 2. Fun crux.
content.protection:
P1: 12 bolts, chain anchors.

P2: 11 bolts, chain anchors.

Descend in 2 rappels with a single 60 meter rope.
content.location: This route follows the prominent continuous blunt buttress on the left side of the Dark Side of the Moon formation.

climbs.name: White Rabbit
climbs.fa: bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, and Mike Engle, Sept 2017

content.description: This is a long single pitch route up the middle of the Dark Side of the Moon formation.  Start on featured rock and move up to stance below a blank face. The crux is moving up and left into left facing corner.  Follow the corner/arete until it becomes a chert face climb.  Continue on fun but easier climbing to the anchors.
content.protection: 17 bolts and chain anchors.  2 ropes required to descend.
content.location: Center of the Dark Side of the Moon formation.  Look for the name tag on the first bolt.

climbs.name: Golden Years
climbs.fa: bolted by Chris Barnes, Mike Engle & Vernon Phinney, July 2018

content.description:
P1 (5.9) Start 10 feet right of Freebird and climb a steep thin section, then trend left to a ledge just left of a large bush.  Belay at the first anchors of Freebird.

P2 (5.10-) Move up and right following a diagonalling chert line until its possible to make an exciting move left to the edge of a shallow left facing corner.  Make the move left as soon as possible to keep the grade 10- (if you wait the move becomes more like hard 5.10).  Move up from the corner onto large chert holds.  Continue more or less straight up on sometimes thin chert holds.  Pull a headwall and move left to the the top anchors of Freebird.

Note: can be led in one long pitch with 22 quickdraws and some rope management to reduce drag.
content.protection: P1:  8 bolts; P2: 14 bolts.  Use the chain anchors of Freebird for belaying and rappelling.  A single 60 meter rope and two rappels to descend.
content.location: Find a bolt line directly below a large bush on a ledge about 60 feet off the ground.  Name tag is on the first bolt.

climbs.name: Freebird
climbs.fa: bolted by Vernon Phinney and Chris Barnes, Sept 2017;  FFA: Linda Engle and Annik Martin Sept 2017

content.description:
P1: 5.7.  Climb featured grey limestone up runnels and past small ledges to a large ledge with chain anchors which are left of a prominent large bush on the wall.

P2:  5.8.  Continue more or less straight up on featured limestone and chert.  About 1/2 way up there is a move left to gain crack.  Follow the crack back left and then up to the sport anchors at the top of the pitch.
content.protection:
P1:  5.7.  10 bolts.

P2:  5.8.  12 bolts.

Single 60 meter rope will get you back to the ground in two rappels.
content.location: 20 feet left of White Rabbit.  Look for the name tag on the the first bolt.  Route's second anchors are just left of 3 or 4 grey streaks near the top of the crag.

climbs.name: Dream Weaver
climbs.fa: bolted by Mike Engle and Vernon Phinney, Sept 2017; FFA:  Kira Engle & Kevin Macartney, June 2018;

content.description: Start in a broken right facing corner and move up to a stance below short blank section of rock.  Using tiny handholds and bad feet move slightly right and up to big hand hold. Pull up to a stance and continue more or less straight up on big chert.  Continue up as the route becomes steeper, the chert smaller and holds more spaced apart.  Pull a second thin crux for the last couple bolts before the anchors.
content.protection: About 15 bolts, chain anchors. One 70 meter rope to the ground or two 60 meter ropes to rappel.
content.location: There is a prominent black streak that separates the Dark Side of the Moon formation from Stone Temple.  Dream Weavers starts about 20 feet left of the black streak.

climbs.name: Crazy Diamond
climbs.fa: bolted by Mike Engle, Chris Barnes, & Vernon Phinney, Sept 2017; FFA:  Mike Engle and Linda Engle Sept 2017

content.description: Climb steep featured limestone runnels and chert to right leaning crack.  Mostly face climb plus a couple jams until you can stem up a shallow steep corner on exciting chert holds.  At the second to last bolt you can step left to the party ledge and the sport anchors of Don't Fear the Reaper on the Sea of Joy formation or stay on the steep ramp and move up and right past one more bolt to the chain anchors on the first pitch of Wish You Were Here.
content.protection: 7 bolts to Don't Fear the Reaper anchors or 8 bolts to the Wish You Were Here pitch 1 anchors.  In either case a 60 meter rope will get you back to the ground.
content.location: Start in the deep gully between the Sea of Joy and Dark Side of the Moon formations.  Just right of Don't Fear the Reaper.

climbs.name: Cherts So Good
climbs.fa: bolted by Chris Barnes, Mike Engle & Vernon Phinney, June 2018

content.description: Climb the first 4 bolts of Creep (5.9) and step left across the prominent black streak and continue up for another 10 bolts of steep chert pinching to the anchors.  Steep and fun with solid chert.
content.protection: 15 bolts to sport anchors. 60 meter rope to lower back to the ground - just makes it! Knot the end of the rope on the belayer end.
content.location: This is the right most route on Dark Side of the Moon just left of the prominent black streak that separates Dark Side of the Moon from Stone Temple.  The route starts on Creep (5.9) which is just right of the black streak and is the left most route on Stone Temple.

climbs.name: Another One Bites the Dust
climbs.fa: Vernon Phinney and Mike Engle, July 2018

content.description: This route starts on large party ledge on the right side of Sea of Joy.  From the anchors on the ledge, move right and stem up the dihedral that is the boundary between Sea of Joy and Dark Side of the Moon.  Continue stemming up and over a bulge and pull onto the face with some chert holds.  Follow a left trending line of chert to the anchors.
content.protection: 14 bolts, sport anchor.  Lower back to the party ledge with a 60 meter rope.  Rappel to the ground with a single rope from the chain anchors on the party ledge.
content.location: This is the left most route on Dark Side of the Moon and starts on the large party ledge on the right side of Sea of Joy.  Use "Crazy Diamond"  or "Don't Fear the Reaper" as an approach pitch.
